meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unbreakable or unyielding.
meanings.sent1: The infrangibility of the diamond made it perfect for the engagement ring.
meanings.sent2: The infrangibility of the fortress walls protected the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The infrangibility of the cookie jar led to a comical attempt to open it.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit had an infrangibility that inspired those around her.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's shield symbolized his infrangibility in the face of danger.

meanings.definition: The inability to be violated or infringed upon.
meanings.sent1: The infrangibility of the law ensured justice for all.
meanings.sent2: The infrangibility of her privacy was respected by all her friends.
meanings.sent3: The infrangibility of the 'Do Not Disturb' sign was tested by the mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty to his country had an infrangibility that never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact's infrangibility hinted at its mystical powers.
